channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Improved transferability of self-supervised learning models through batch normalization finetuning
item.description: At a cost of extra training of only 0. 16% model parameters, in case of ResNet-50, we acquire a proxy task that (i) has a stronger correlation with end-to-end finetuned performance, (ii) improves the linear probing performance in the many- and few-shot learning regimes and (iii) in some cases, outperforms both linear probing and end-to-end finetuning, reaching the state-of-the-art performance on a pathology dataset.

item.title: Cross-Platform Video Person ReID: A New Benchmark Dataset and Adaptation Approach
item.description: In this paper, we construct a large-scale benchmark dataset for Ground-to-Aerial Video-based person Re-Identification, named G2A-VReID, which comprises 185, 907 images and 5, 576 tracklets, featuring 2, 788 distinct identities.

item.title: Towards Few-shot Self-explaining Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Subsequently, the predictor mimics the decision-making process, which makes predictions based on the generated explanation.

item.title: TabularBench: Benchmarking Adversarial Robustness for Tabular Deep Learning in Real-world Use-cases
item.description: In addition to our open benchmark (https://github. com/serval-uni-lu/tabularbench) where we welcome submissions of new models and defenses, we implement 7 robustification mechanisms inspired by state-of-the-art defenses in computer vision and propose the largest benchmark of robust tabular deep learning over 200 models across five critical scenarios in finance, healthcare and security.

item.title: Adaptive Basis Function Selection for Computationally Efficient Predictions
item.description: Basis Function (BF) expansions are a cornerstone of any engineer's toolbox for computational function approximation which shares connections with both neural networks and Gaussian processes.

item.title: Aquila2 Technical Report
item.description: This paper introduces the Aquila2 series, which comprises a wide range of bilingual models with parameter sizes of 7, 34, and 70 billion.

item.title: LiPCoT: Linear Predictive Coding based Tokenizer for Self-supervised Learning of Time Series Data via Language Models
item.description: In particular, we utilize LiPCoT to encode EEG data into a small vocabulary of tokens and then use BERT for self-supervised learning and the downstream task of PD classification.

item.title: Graph Triple Attention Network: A Decoupled Perspective
item.description: To address these challenges, we propose a high-level decoupled perspective of GTs, breaking them down into three components and two interaction levels: positional attention, structural attention, and attribute attention, alongside local and global interaction.

item.title: q-exponential family for policy optimization
item.description: In this paper, we consider a broader policy family that remains tractable: the $q$-exponential family.

item.title: Domain-invariant Representation Learning via Segment Anything Model for Blood Cell Classification
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a novel framework of domain-invariant representation learning (DoRL) via segment anything model (SAM) for blood cell classification.

item.title: Alignment-Enhanced Decoding:Defending via Token-Level Adaptive Refining of Probability Distributions
item.description: Large language models are susceptible to jailbreak attacks, which can result in the generation of harmful content.

item.title: GRIF-DM: Generation of Rich Impression Fonts using Diffusion Models
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a diffusion-based method, termed \ourmethod, to generate fonts that vividly embody specific impressions, utilizing an input consisting of a single letter and a set of descriptive impression keywords.

item.title: Model Merging in LLMs, MLLMs, and Beyond: Methods, Theories, Applications and Opportunities
item.description: Model merging is an efficient empowerment technique in the machine learning community that does not require the collection of raw training data and does not require expensive computation.

item.title: Optimising Dynamic Traffic Distribution for Urban Networks with Answer Set Programming
item.description: Answer Set Programming (ASP) has demonstrated its potential as an effective tool for concisely representing and reasoning about real-world problems.

item.title: MetaSeg: MetaFormer-based Global Contexts-aware Network for Efficient Semantic Segmentation
item.description: We propose a powerful semantic segmentation network, MetaSeg, which leverages the Metaformer architecture from the backbone to the decoder.

item.title: CNN-JEPA: Self-Supervised Pretraining Convolutional Neural Networks Using Joint Embedding Predictive Architecture
item.description: Self-supervised learning (SSL) has become an important approach in pretraining large neural networks, enabling unprecedented scaling of model and dataset sizes.

item.title: One Step Diffusion-based Super-Resolution with Time-Aware Distillation
item.description: Specifically, we introduce a novel score distillation strategy to align the data distribution between the outputs of the student and teacher models after minor noise perturbation.

item.title: PeriodWave: Multi-Period Flow Matching for High-Fidelity Waveform Generation
item.description: Additionally, we utilize a multi-period estimator that avoids overlaps to capture different periodic features of waveform signals.

item.title: Achieving Data Efficient Neural Networks with Hybrid Concept-based Models
item.description: Most datasets used for supervised machine learning consist of a single label per data point.

item.title: Unsupervised Stereo Matching Network For VHR Remote Sensing Images Based On Error Prediction
item.description: In contrast, unsupervised learning methods can leverage the increasing availability of very-high-resolution (VHR) remote sensing images, offering considerable potential in the realm of stereo matching.

item.title: Detecting Near-Duplicate Face Images
item.description: Near-duplicate images are often generated when applying repeated photometric and geometric transformations that produce imperceptible variants of the original image.

item.title: Ensemble architecture in polyp segmentation
item.description: In this research, we revisit the architecture of semantic segmentation and evaluate the models excelling in polyp segmentation.

item.title: Knowledge Distillation with Refined Logits
item.description: Recent research on knowledge distillation has increasingly focused on logit distillation because of its simplicity, effectiveness, and versatility in model compression.

item.title: Robust Semi-supervised Multimodal Medical Image Segmentation via Cross Modality Collaboration
item.description: With a channel-wise semantic consistency loss, our framework ensures alignment of modality-independent information from a feature-wise perspective across modalities, thereby fortifying it against misalignments in multimodal scenarios.

item.title: Wasserstein Gradient Flows of MMD Functionals with Distance Kernel and Cauchy Problems on Quantile Functions
item.description:
We give a comprehensive description of Wasserstein gradient flows of maximum mean discrepancy (MMD) functionals $\mathcal F_
u := 	ext{MMD}_K^2(\cdot, 
u)$ towards given target measures $
u$ on the real line, where we focus on the negative distance kernel $K(x, y) := -|x-y|$.

item.title: BadMerging: Backdoor Attacks Against Model Merging
item.description: Considering that a merged model may incorporate tasks from different domains, BadMerging can jointly compromise the tasks provided by the adversary (on-task attack) and other contributors (off-task attack) and solve the corresponding unique challenges with novel attack designs.

item.title: A Spitting Image: Modular Superpixel Tokenization in Vision Transformers
item.description: Vision Transformer (ViT) architectures traditionally employ a grid-based approach to tokenization independent of the semantic content of an image.

item.title: Knowledge in Superposition: Unveiling the Failures of Lifelong Knowledge Editing for Large Language Models
item.description: Moreover, this is the first study to investigate knowledge editing from the perspective of superposition and provides a comprehensive observation of superposition across numerous real-world language models.

item.title: Pattern-Matching Dynamic Memory Network for Dual-Mode Traffic Prediction
item.description: PM-DMNet employs a novel dynamic memory network to capture traffic pattern features with only O(N) complexity, significantly reducing computational overhead while achieving excellent performance.

item.title: Sum-Product-Set Networks
item.description: Daily internet communication relies heavily on tree-structured graphs, embodied by popular data formats such as XML and JSON.

item.title: BAPLe: Backdoor Attacks on Medical Foundational Models using Prompt Learning
item.description: Inspired by the latest developments in learnable prompts, this work introduces a method to embed a backdoor into the medical foundation model during the prompt learning phase.

item.title: SigmaRL: A Sample-Efficient and Generalizable Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning Framework for Motion Planning
item.description: Most RL agents exhibit a limited capacity to generalize, often focusing narrowly on specific scenarios, and are usually evaluated in similar or even the same scenarios seen during training.

item.title: Whitening Consistently Improves Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: In this study, we propose incorporating ZCA whitening as the final layer of the encoder in self-supervised learning to enhance the quality of learned features by normalizing and decorrelating them.

item.title: Lesion-aware network for diabetic retinopathy diagnosis
item.description: To this end, we propose a CNN-based DR diagnosis network with attention mechanism involved, termed lesion-aware network, to better capture lesion information from imbalanced data.

item.title: Improved 3D Whole Heart Geometry from Sparse CMR Slices
item.description: In this study, we explore the combination of Slice Shifting Algorithm (SSA), Spatial Transformer Network (STN), and Label Transformer Network (LTN) to: 1) correct respiratory motion between segmented slices, and 2) transform sparse segmentation data into dense segmentation.

item.title: Towards Real-time Video Compressive Sensing on Mobile Devices
item.description: The fast evolving mobile devices and existing high-performance video SCI reconstruction algorithms motivate us to develop mobile reconstruction methods for real-world applications.

item.title: GRFormer: Grouped Residual Self-Attention for Lightweight Single Image Super-Resolution
item.description: The code is available at \url{https://github. com/sisrformer/GRFormer}.

item.title: ReCLIP++: Learn to Rectify the Bias of CLIP for Unsupervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we propose to explicitly model and rectify the bias existing in CLIP to facilitate the unsupervised semantic segmentation task.

item.title: Flexible 3D Lane Detection by Hierarchical Shape MatchingFlexible 3D Lane Detection by Hierarchical Shape Matching
item.description: As one of the basic while vital technologies for HD map construction, 3D lane detection is still an open problem due to varying visual conditions, complex typologies, and strict demands for precision.

item.title: Improving Synthetic Image Detection Towards Generalization: An Image Transformation Perspective
item.description: In this paper, we re-examine the SID problem and identify two prevalent biases in current training paradigms, i. e., weakened artifact features and overfitted artifact features.

item.title: Unified-IoU: For High-Quality Object Detection
item.description: Specifically, the loss function dynamically shifts the model's attention from low-quality prediction boxes to high-quality prediction boxes in a novel way to enhance the model's detection performance on high-precision or intensive datasets and achieve a balance in training speed.

item.title: AquilaMoE: Efficient Training for MoE Models with Scale-Up and Scale-Out Strategies
item.description: In this paper, we present AquilaMoE, a cutting-edge bilingual 8*16B Mixture of Experts (MoE) language model that has 8 experts with 16 billion parameters each and is developed using an innovative training methodology called EfficientScale.

item.title: Integration of Genetic Algorithms and Deep Learning for the Generation and Bioactivity Prediction of Novel Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitors
item.description: The intersection of artificial intelligence and bioinformatics has enabled significant advancements in drug discovery, particularly through the application of machine learning models.

item.title: The News Comment Gap and Algorithmic Agenda Setting in Online Forums
item.description: It is thus important to understand journalist vs reader comment preferences and how these are served by various comment ranking algorithms that represent discussions differently.

item.title: Multi-Agent Continuous Control with Generative Flow Networks
item.description: Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) aim to generate diverse trajectories from a distribution in which the final states of the trajectories are proportional to the reward, serving as a powerful alternative to reinforcement learning for exploratory control tasks.

item.title: Towards Cross-Domain Single Blood Cell Image Classification via Large-Scale LoRA-based Segment Anything Model
item.description: Accurate classification of blood cells plays a vital role in hematological analysis as it aids physicians in diagnosing various medical conditions.

item.title: OpenResearcher: Unleashing AI for Accelerated Scientific Research
item.description: The rapid growth of scientific literature imposes significant challenges for researchers endeavoring to stay updated with the latest advancements in their fields and delve into new areas.

item.title: GLGait: A Global-Local Temporal Receptive Field Network for Gait Recognition in the Wild
item.description: Recently, some Convolution Neural Networks (ConvNets) based methods have been proposed to address the issue of gait recognition in the wild.

item.title: Causal Agent based on Large Language Model
item.description: In the tools module, the causal agent applies causal methods to align tabular data with natural language.

item.title: HDRGS: High Dynamic Range Gaussian Splatting
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Gaussian Splatting-a recent, high-quality, real-time 3D reconstruction technique-into this domain.
